Award.AwardTitle: Geometry and topology of curves and surfaces in closed hyperbolic manifolds
Award.AbstractNarration:
The PI will study questions about geometry and topology of closed hyperbolic manifolds. In connection with the Virtual Haken Conjecture, the question of whether a hyperbolic 3-manifold contains an abundance of equidistributed essential 3-manifolds with incompressible boundary will be addressed. Higher dimensional hyperbolic manifolds will be studied and the aim is to prove that every closed hyperbolic manifold of dimension at least 4 contains an essential 3-manifold group. Also, it will be shown that the Simple Loop Conjecture fails in every dimension greater than or equal to 4. Related problems (in particular the Surface Subgroup Conjecture) will be address for other hyperbolic spaces, like complex hyperbolic spaces or hyperbolic groups.


Pure mathematics is a breeding ground for ideas that are later utilized in natural sciences like physics and biology. In physics, the universe is described as a 3-dimensional space, thus studying geometry and topology of 3-manifolds may prove very important in the real life physical questions that we face.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The first main outcome of this project is the completion of the proof of the Ehrenpreis conjecture. The proof of this major result is based on the methods we recently introduced in the proof of the Surface Subgroup Theorem. This theorem played a key part in the later proof of the Virtual Haken Theorem and the virtual classification of 3-manifolds. These are major results whose consequences will be very significant in low dimensional topology. The reader may consult the article written for general audiences by Erica Klereich about these results and applications.


The second main achievement of this proposal is the proof of the Schoen Conjecture for hyperbolic 3-spaces. This says that every quasiconformal maps of the 2-sphere can be extended to a harmonic map of the hyperbolic space. This introduced new methods and ideas that will lead to the proof of these conjectures in general.


The work on homology of curves and surfaces used the methods of randomly gluing surfaces to prove provide a clear geometric alternative to the standard homology theory on 3-manifolds. Also, I showed that the surface subgroup conjecture for hyperbolic groups would imply the Cannon's conjecture which may have impact on proving this important conjecture in the Geometric Group theory.
